item.title: Bins, 12th December
item.description:
This is a persistent problem on our street. I don’t know whether we need more frequent bin collections or if members of the public are using this space as a dumping ground but it is unsanitary and it’s fuelling rodents into the flats attached.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Farleigh Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing litter bin with rubbish and litter now being piled up around it, 12th December
item.description:
It is a regular occurrence for this litter bin to be abused and filled to overflowing with litter then piling up around it often from kids eating their lunch in or close to the park then leaving their detritus and remains everywhere and anywhere. It's also a regular dumping ground for those too lazy to find another bin or go to a recycling centre. Ideally, it should be removed, as the recycle bins were a while ago or at least moved onto the main road (Anerley Hill) so it's in public view and possibly covered by a CCTV camera. I sympathise with council workers who constantly have to clear this area up - it must be pretty soul destroying for them as it is for me and others!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-3, Ledrington Road, Crystal Palace, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti on railway bridge road sude, 12th December
item.description:
Graffiti on the external parapet wall of the District Line bridge over South End Road, Hornchurch (near postcode RM12 5TX). The TfL/LUL bridge identifier is D203 — “South End Road Overbridge”. The centre of the affected parapet is at Lat 51.53598, Long 0.19720. Havering council have confirmed it isn’t their asset and the map to report to TfL doesn’t work as it says the bridge isn’t theirs, which it is
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The street never gets cleaned, 12th December
item.description:
Finsbury Park Road btw somerfield and brownswood Rd gets swept infrequently and there is always accumulating litter. This is a longstanding problem. The road sweeper responsible for this section does not come often enough, please can you investigate.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Finsbury Park Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Life rings have been deployed, 12th December
item.description:
The three life rings in front of sea containers hotel have been deployed and are hanging over the river wall. They need bringing back in. The grid reference of the life ring in the middle of the three rings is TQ314805.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, The Queen's Walk, Southwark, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
